events.originalText: The International Hydrographic Organization abandoned South Korean-led 'attempts to rename the Sea of Japan.
events.subtitle: International Hydrographic Organization
events.headline: International Hydrographic Organization rejects South Korean-led attempt to rename Sea of Japan

events.originalText: Controversy surrounding the relocation of the Bronze Soldier of Tallinn, a Soviet Red Army World War II memorial in Tallinn, Estonia, erupted into mass protests and riots.
events.subtitle: Bronze Soldier of Tallinn
events.headline: Controversy over relocation of Bronze Soldier of Tallinn sparks mass protests in Estonia

events.originalText: Just before landing at Nagoya Airport, Japan, the copilot of China Airlines Flight 140 inadvertently triggered the takeoff/go-around switch, causing the aircraft to crash and killing 264 of the 271 people on board.
events.subtitle: Nagoya Airfield
events.headline: China Airlines Flight 140 crashes in Nagoya, Japan, killing 264

events.originalText: An editorial was published in the People's Daily denouncing the growing unrest in Tiananmen Square in Beijing which would remain contentious through the remainder of the protests.
events.subtitle: April 26 Editorial
events.headline: Editorial in People's Daily denounces unrest in Tiananmen Square

events.originalText: A tornado struck the Manikganj District of Bangladesh and killed an estimated 1,300 people, making it the deadliest tornado in history.
events.subtitle: Daulatpur–Saturia tornado
events.headline: Deadliest tornado in history strikes Manikganj District, Bangladesh

events.originalText: The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) came into being when the WIPO Convention entered into force.
events.subtitle: World Intellectual Property Organization
events.headline: World Intellectual Property Organization established with WIPO Convention

events.originalText: Service ended on the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad's Royal Blue Line, one of the first major electrified train lines in the U.S. (steam train pictured).
events.subtitle: Baltimore and Ohio Railroad
events.headline: Service ends on Baltimore and Ohio Railroad's Royal Blue Line

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. Navy submarines began attacks on Japan's Take Ichi convoy as it sailed in waters between Taiwan and the Philippines, eventually sinking four vessels and killing more than 4,000 troops.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: U.S. Navy submarines sink Japan's Take Ichi convoy, killing over 4,000 troops

events.originalText: Boris Kidrič and Edvard Kardelj founded the Liberation Front of the Slovene Nation, the main anti-fascist Slovene civil-resistance and political organization during World War II.
events.subtitle: Boris Kidrič
events.headline: Liberation Front of the Slovene Nation founded during World War II

events.originalText: The Gestapo, the official secret police force of Nazi Germany, was established.
events.subtitle: Gestapo
events.headline: Gestapo secret police force of Nazi Germany established

events.originalText: First World War: Britain, France and Russia signed a secret treaty promising territory to Italy if it joined the war on their side.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Secret treaty signed promising territory to Italy in First World War

events.originalText: U.S. Army soldiers cornered and fatally shot John Wilkes Booth, the assassin of U.S. president Abraham Lincoln, ending a twelve-day manhunt.
events.subtitle: United States Army
events.headline: John Wilkes Booth, assassin of Abraham Lincoln, shot dead by U.S. Army soldiers

events.originalText: In a conspiracy to replace the Medici family as rulers of the Republic of Florence, the Pazzi family attacked Lorenzo de' Medici (pictured) and killed his brother Giuliano at Florence Cathedral.
events.subtitle: Pazzi conspiracy
events.headline: Pazzi family attacks Lorenzo de' Medici, killing his brother Giuliano in conspiracy at Florence Cathedral
